name: Objectives

tableData.result: Appease the drowned choir with blood-warmed river stones.
Track the whispering steps through ash without looking back.
Bury the traitor’s jawbone where the crows refuse.
Name every ghost in the barracks before dawn breaks.
Carry fire across the bonefield without it guttering.
Drink the well’s memory, then spit truth onto graves.
Unmask the smiling widow who feeds on last words.
Seal the murder door using seven rusted nails.
Trade your shadow for safe passage through moonfog.
Convince the gallows to release their strangled secrets.
Harvest frost from footprints that never melt away.
Scrub the blood-clock until it forgets the hour.
Escort a blighted child past mirrors that beg.
Steal back your name from the hospice bell.
Force the church bell to ring mercy once.
Haggle with the scarecrow for the missing dawn.
Lead the lost regiment to water, deny solace.
Bind the knife that keeps killing in dreams.
Wake the hearth, drown the whisper in soot.
Re-stitch the shepherd’s shadow to his heels.
Drag the river for a voice, not bodies.
Shut every eyelid painted on the barn.
Teach the graveyard dog to ignore your heartbeat.
Salt the footprints circling your camp each night.
Answer the empty cradle without telling lies.
Pick thorns from air where grief grows visible.
Bleed onto ice so the bridge will hold.
Feed the old storm a secret it hates.
Trade names with a mirror, keep the better.
Burn the ledger that writes debts after death.
Follow the lullaby into the mine, return humming.
Give the road a tooth so it forgets you.
Silence the portrait by swallowing its paint.
Carry bones uphill until the hill confesses.
Blindfold the sunrise so the dead can sleep.
Kiss the plague saint’s skull and mean it.
Return the stolen luck to the worst person.
Cut the noose from fog, braid a path.
Make the battlefield eat its own iron.
Share bread with the thing under the floor.
Convince rain to fall only on liars.
Turn a scream into rope, climb the tower.
Give up warmth to pass the winter gate.
Weigh a sorrow on scales that bite back.
Smother the hearthmouth coughing up children’s names.
Translate the wolf’s apology carved into bark.
Nail your shadow to midnight, walk free briefly.
Teach ashes to forget faces, failing costs flesh.
Let the last candle judge you, accept verdict.
Plant a tongue in salt, harvest clean silence.

description: The Haunted Aspect marks places where the past refuses to stay buried: echoes of violence, grief, or betrayal seep into the land, twisting memories into lingering presences. In a Haunted environment, the world feels aware and watchful; small coincidences, half-heard whispers, and impossible shadows hint that something old and wrong is still reaching for the living.

name: Atmosphere

tableData.result: Cold breath on the nape
Footsteps follow, never arrive
Shadows lean in to listen
Names carved beneath peeling skin
Walls remember every argument
Bloodstain that refuses sunlight
Mirrors blink a moment late
Whispers learn your true name
Rust tastes like old prayers
Floorboards sigh with disappointment
Echoes heavier than the voice
Toys face corners by themselves
Windows sweat in moonlight
Chill settles into knuckles
Stale incense clings like guilt
A lullaby with missing words
Keys jingle in empty pockets
Door latches close politely
Your shadow staggers behind
The well hums with hunger
Wet footprints lead nowhere
Candles gutter toward you
Owls refuse to look here
Laughter loops, frayed and thin
Ash tastes of family names
Crows argue with bare rafters
Silver spoons warp when touched
Rain remembers a massacre
Dust patterns form prayer hands
Graves lean like drunks listening
Clocks tick with missing beats
Milk sours at your glance
Bedsheet cool where someone lay
Night air smells like iron
Crossroads whisper bad bargains
Mouth dry with borrowed thirst
Latch lifts without a hand
Dreams step into waking rooms
Portrait eyes shine with brine
A sigh under the hearth
Rope fibers itch the wrist
Teeth ache near the cellar
Wind learns to speak names
Moss grows in shoeprints
Coins ring from empty purse
Frost blooms in a circle
Candle smoke curls toward graves
Shoes filled with creek silt
Stairs descend a step extra
Bread molds in minutes here
Back turned, breath on cheek
Faint music from dry reeds
Salt line never stays straight
Pages turn despite no draft
Thorn hedges point inward
Murmurs behind locked ribs
Flies gather where there’s none
Nails rust overnight indoors
A heartbeat under the floor
Reflections argue with your gestures
Soot patterns like grasping hands
Windows show last year’s sky
Bells ring where church fell
Mud clings with stubborn affection
Lantern light curdles, dims early
A knife hums near portraits
Water tastes of sleeplessness
Footprints circle the bed
Iron pendants burn the skin
Creaks spell out accusations
Lull in wind like waiting
Cats hiss at empty sleeves
Grout seeping a pink smear
Shiver without the winter
Prayer swallowed before spoken
A chair rocking itself tired
Bones hidden inside the wallpaper
Distant weeping from bare branches
Warm corner gone ice-cold
Soil shifts under every step
Stitching unthreads on its own
Taste of pennies on breath
Wet hair in a dry sink
Murmured apologies from the rafters
The moon avoids these eaves
Hands tingle near the threshold
Ink blots form last words
Path loops back with fewer footprints
Faces ripple in puddles
Child’s hum from locked chest
Smoke smells like wet wool
Tongue heavy with old lies
Cold sits where sunlight pools
Every knock sounds like knuckles
Doorframe notches tally mistakes
Rain hits roof in patterns
ACTION + THEME
ROLL TWICE

description: The Haunted Aspect marks places where the past refuses to stay buried: echoes of violence, grief, or betrayal seep into the land, twisting memories into lingering presences. In a Haunted environment, the world feels aware and watchful; small coincidences, half-heard whispers, and impossible shadows hint that something old and wrong is still reaching for the living.

name: Manifestations

tableData.result: Footprints fill with blood, then vanish
A mirror that reflects older wounds
Door hinge sighs names of the dead
Ashen snow falls upward, whispering guilt
A cradle rocking without wind
Wet handprints climbing the ceiling
Rusty bells toll with no clapper
Shadows blink, but walls do not
A noose knots itself each dusk
Faded portraits turn their faces away
Cold breath fogs from empty armor
Stones weep salt at spilled lies
A hearth burns bones, not logs
Old letters bleed through fresh ink
Milk curdles when vows are spoken
A dog growls at absent riders
Crows perch in rooms, never leaving
Bedsprings groan under unseen weight
A well echoes sobs, not voices
Moonlight puddles, slick as oil
Keys turn locks from the inside
Eyeless dolls watch for returning fathers
Moss shapes into pleading hands
Chalk circles smear with phantom feet
Lantern flames lean toward buried secrets
Icicles drip warm as fresh blood
A violin plays with snapped strings
Floorboards swell like a held breath
Old armor leaks river water nightly
Prayer beads knot into strangler’s grip
A book writes apologies by itself
Mud prints lead into a mirror
Graveyard yews bend toward a cradle
Laundry twists into shrouds mid-breeze
A child’s laugh under drowning water
Knife handles sweat, blades stay dry
Soot sketches scenes of last betrayals
Windows frost in hand-shaped blooms
A clock counts heartbeats, not hours
Wildflowers bloom only on boot tracks
Candles gutter when truth is spoken
An empty chair scrapes closer nightly
Rain hits roofs in marching rows
Salt circles crawl toward sleeping throats
A bridge hums with drowned hymns
Fresh bread tastes of river silt
Wolves refuse meat from this soil
THE WEAVE
ACTION + THEME
ROLL TWICE

name: Discoveries

tableData.result: Cold breath from a locked well
Blood-soaked cradle rocking by itself
Footprints pacing in cooling ash
Rusty censer that exhales sobs
Mirror reflecting a stranger’s wounds
Empty gallows creaking under invisible weight
Milky-eyed raven whispering old names
Bone dice that roll accused numbers
Doorframe stained with handprints that drip upward
Damp bootprints leading into the wall
Wedding ring biting deep into bark
War trumpet that only mourns
Shovel that throws the dirt back
Dusty ledger rewriting debts at night
Bed where the mattress trembles gently
Lantern oil that burns blue regrets
Unlit hearth coughing out children’s laughter
Needle that stitches itself through skin
Prayer flags knotting in silent panic
Empty chair warming like a body
Knife that remembers every throat
Mosaic floor rearranging into pleading faces
Shepherd’s bell chiming from buried ground
Ashen dolls closing their eyes together
Bridle that bleeds from the bit
Frozen puddle showing drowning bubbles
Chessboard where pawns weep crimson tears
Key that refuses to open graves
Drumbeat echoing from within the drum
Crows roosting on an invisible rider
Faded banner smelling of fresh slaughter
Coffin nails humming a wedding hymn
Tomb inscription that changes the date
Hourglass dripping clotted, sluggish sand
Window frost mapping forgotten battle lines
Scarecrow bowing to no wind
Lullaby trapped in a cracked locket
Candles gutter when lies are spoken
Mud swallowing footprints with a sigh
Icicles ringing like broken bells
Wishing well coins screaming underwater
Splintered helm that gnaws the scalp
Dead orchard rustling with unseen harvest
Crossroads milestone bleeding in daylight
Soup pot boiling names and numbers
Bookshelves shifting to hide a page
Rain only falling on one grave

name: Banes

tableData.result: Cold spots creep under armor
Whispers bait you by your name
Footsteps follow, never seen
Sleep clots with borrowed memories
Mirrors show wounds you never took
Dead birds point their beaks
Old guilt tastes like iron coins
Shadows lag and mutter prayers
Blood stains reappear every dawn
Paths loop back to graves
Candles burn with black tears
A child laughs from empty rooms
Your breath fogs with sobbing voices
Doors swell, refusing honest exits
Names fade from your own tongue
Bones knock inside the walls
Fingers tug your cloak at night
Time stutters around fresh sorrow
Lies echo as thunderous truth
Invisible hands rearrange your tools
Hearthfire smells like wet gravecloth
Dreams drag you through old murders
Ink crawls off the page
Your reflection looks disappointed
Rusted bells ring at wrong hours
Dead lovers mouth unfinished curses
Every wound reopens in moonlight
Children’s chalk marks change places
Crows speak with a familiar voice
Soil pulses like a sick heart

Steps sink in dry floorboards
Forgotten debts collect in bruises
Silence presses like soaked wool
Roadside shrines demand your breath
Locks click open when you pray
Ash footprints circle campfires nightly
Prayers return with someone else’s accent
Colors leach from honest faces
Your shadow flinches before blows
Cradles rock where no child sleeps
Wind carries the taste of mourning
Grins twitch on carved saints
Maps redraw to old battle lines
Teeth chatter inside closed jars
Wolves refuse your offered mercy
Coins bleed when counted aloud
Kettles scream like drowning men

name: Boons

tableData.result: Shadows warn before blades find flesh
Ghost hands steady your bleeding grip
Footsteps echo, masking your retreat

Memories sharpen, names of foes remembered
Grave-chill numbs pain for one strike
Moonlit phantoms scout the silent road
Echoed screams startle foes into hesitation
Pale lights mark safe stepping stones
The dead tug you from snares

Fallen comrades’ voices call accurate shots
Old sins frighten superstitious guards aside
